main event: An 87-year-old woman observed a pink oval-shaped object in the sky for about 30 seconds on April 29, 1952, in Topeka, Kansas.
interesting points: The object was stationary and appeared to be descending,The object emitted beams that were thought to be driven by searchlights,It was observed through binoculars by an Air Force lieutenant on May 7, 1952, who described it as circular and metallic,The lieutenant's sighting lasted approximately 45 seconds and reported no conventional aircraft in the area,The woman's reliability as a witness is unknown due to her age.
witness description: an 87-year-old woman and a lieutenant in the USAF
